en: Abass Akande Obesere (born on January 20, 1965) well known as "Omo Rapala" is Nigerian musician, singer, and record producer that hail from Ibadan, a notable place in Nigeria.

pcm: E dey folo di Sikiru Ayinde Barrister ezampul wey pipul sabi wel wel for Naijá an for di wold, Obesere don kari im muzik go difren difren kontri sef.

pcm: Abayomi Adebayo Barber (dem bon am for October 23, 1928 an e dai for December 26, 2021) na Naija pesin wey dey draw fain fain tins for Naijá an e bi di oga for Barber Art School wey dey insaid Legos for Naija.
en: Abayomi Adebayo Barber (born on October 23, 1928 and died on December 26, 2021), a Nigerian artist and a director of Barber Art School in Lagos, Nigeria

pcm: E get koneshion wel wel for insaid Naijá muzik but plenti oyibo pipul no sabi am.
en: He is well connected within the Nigerian music industry but many foreigners do not know him.

pcm: Dem rili sabi am as pesin wey biliv sey evritin wey dey hapun for dis laif jost dey hapun an dem sabi am as pesin wey biliv sey dream dey hapun.
en: He is really known as one that believes that life happenings occur and dreams do come true.

pcm: Barber don rait som tins abaut di foma presido for Naija wey di nem na Murtala Mohammed an anoda pesin wey don bi Oba for Ile-Ife bifor wey im nem na Adesoji Aderemi.
en: Barber wrote some articles about the former Nigerian president, Murtala Mohammed and the former king of Ile-Ife, Adesoji Aderemi.

pcm: One of e wok wey pipul sabi wel wel na di one wey im yuz oil pent tek draw Shehu Shagari.
en: One of his well known works is an oil painting of Shehu Shagari

pcm: Dem born Barber for October 23, 1928 for Ile-Ife for Samuel Bamidele an Victoria Waleola Barber famili.
en: Barber was born on October 23, 1928 in Ile-Ife, into the family of Samuel Bamidele and Victoria Waleola Barber.

pcm: Na for St Peter's Anglican School e tek stat im skul mata for Iremo wey dey inside Ife an na for 1948 im finish im skul for St Stephen's Skul for inside Modakeke for Ife.
en: He started his education in St Peter's Anglican School in Iremo in Ife and he finished in 1948 in St Stephen's School in inside Modakeke, Ife.

pcm: For 1949, Barber yuz stik du one fain tin an im kom du plenti kompitishon for insaid dat year.
en: In 1949, Barber designed a fine artwork with sticks and participated several competitions.

pcm: Na for 1952 pipu stat to sabi am for Legos wen im win one kompitishon wey Elder Dempster dey du wey di nem na Lines Silver Cup bikos na im win am as di pesin wey di tin wey im draw fain pas for di Nigeria Festival of the Arts.
en: In 1952, he started gaining popularity in Lagos where he won a competition that was organized by Elder Dempster that's called Lines Silver Cup as the best drawing at the All Nigeria Festival of the Arts

pcm: Afta dem giv am di prize, dem kom tel am to draw di oga kpata-kpata for Ikoyi klub wey wan stop to bi di oga kpata-kpata wey im nem na Harold Cooper.
en: After he won the prize, he was asked to draw the general director of ikoyi club, Harold Cooper, as he retires from the position of the general director of the club.

pcm: Dem giv Barber wok for Legos wen 1952 jost dey stat as pesin wey dey draw for buk an for pipul wey wan mek evribodi sabi wetin dem dey sel for one Naijá Kompini for Yaba insaid Legos.
en: Barber got a job in Lagos in 1952 as an artist that draws in book and a Nigerian advertisement compsny in Yaba, Lagos.

pcm: For 1955, Barber join one pipul wey de yuz stone do fain-fain tins for Yaba College of Technology wey di oga kpata-kpata na one man wey kom from Britain wey im nem na Paul Mount.
en: In 1955, Barber joined a group that draws  sculptures in Yaba College of Technology that is headed by a Britain called Paul Mount.

pcm: For 1957, one of Barber papa broda wey e nem na Adesoji Aderemi kari am go mit Awolowo wey bi di oga kpata-kpata for Westa Naijá.
en: In 1957, Adesoji Aderemi, a brother of Barber's father, took Barber to meet Awolowo, the head of Western Nigeria

pcm: Bikos of dis one, e kom join di pipul wey dey du plenti-plenti tins to see if dem go sabi as di Yoruba pipul tek stat.Barber wok as pesin wey bi dey folo pesin du plenti tins an dis one mek am see plenti big-big pipul laik Saburi Biobaku, William Fagg, Frank Willet an Dr Bradburty.
en: Because of this, he joined the researchers that study the origin of Yoruba. As a result of his hardwork, Barber worked with notable people like Saburi Biobaku, William Fagg, Frank Willet and Dr Bradburty.

pcm: For 1960 go rish 1962 di Govament kari am go Central School of Arts and Crafts for London.
en: The government took him to  Central School of Arts and Crafts for London from 1960 - 1962

pcm: For dis skul, Barber len how to kip tins mek dem no spoil an e kom stil kontiniu di wok wey dem yuz stone tek mek Obafemi Awolowo.
en: At the school, Barber learned how to recycle materials and he designed an artwork of Obafemi Awolowo with stones.

pcm: Wahala kom hapun for insaid di Govament wey kom mek govament stop to dey pay for im skul.
en: There were troubles in the administration which affected the government to stop paying for his education.

pcm: As im dey for England e kontiniu to dey len how to dey draw, e len how dem dey yuz stone mek fain fain tins for  Mancini an Tozer studios wey dey inside London.
en: While in England, he continue learning how to draw including how to use stone to design in Mancini and Tozer studios in London

pcm: Barber stil wok as di pesin wey folo di oga kpata-kpata for one studio wey Edward Delaney get an e kom stil wok for Oscar Nemon Studio for St James Studio for London.Barber wok wit Nemon to yuz stone do five difren difren fain design of Winston Churchill.
en: Barber worked with the director of a studio owned by Edward Delaney and Nemon Studio in St James Studio in London. Barber worked with Nemon to use stones to sculpt five different designs of Winston Churchill.

pcm: Na im stil bi di sekond oga for di ples wey dem kip plenti tins wey don tey for laif for Britain.
en: He is the second director of the institution where things that have been in Britian for a long time are stored.

pcm: Na for 1971 e kom bak to Naijá an dem giv am wok as pesin we dey draw for insaid School of African And Asian Studies wey di nem now na Center for Cultural Studies for University of Lagos.
en: He returned back to Nigeria in 1971 and got a job as an artist in School of African And Asian Studies which is now called Center for Cultural Studies for University of Lagos.

pcm: Dem kom tel am to draw di pesin we dey rul for Ethopia wey im nem na Haile Selassie for di taim wen e kom Naijá.
en: He was told to draw an Ethophian ruler named Haile Selassie who paid a visit to Nigeria.

pcm: Wen Barber kom bak to Naijá, e no laik di way dem dey tek draw for hie bikos im biliv sey if pesin kontiniu to dey draw evritaim, di pesin go rili sabi di wok wel-wel.Barber stat to dey tich pipul di wok for 1973 an na Muri Adejim im fest tich for inside di yunivasiti.
en: When Barber came back to Nigeria, he disliked the present state of art in the country because he believed that consistency will perfect an artist's work. Barber started teaching people about arts in 1973 and he first student was Muri Adejimi at the university

pcm: Na for 1989 Barber fest sho plenti pipul im wok an e kol am Abayomi Barber A Retrospective.
en: Barber had an exhibition of his work for the first time in 1989 which he called Abayomi Barber A Retrospective.

pcm: Som of im wok stil dey for insaid National Gallery of Modern Art laik di one wey im yuz stone design Ali Maigoro an Yemoja.
en: Some of his works are still exhibited in the National Gallery of Modern Art including figures of Ali Maigoro and Yemoja that were designed with stones.

pcm: Barber kontiniu to dey draw fain fain tins wit pent an stone an for one buk insaid midu of 2017 e tok abaut im wok an wetin im biliv for laif.
en: Barber continue drawing beautiful artworks with paint and stone, in 2017, he published a book about his work and life beliefs.

pcm: Abba Musa Rimi, CON (dem bon am for 28 February 1940) na one man fom Naija wey pipul chuz mek e bi di pesin wey go rul dem for Kaduna Stet for 1979 wen Naija dey for dia Sekond Ripoblik, dis wan kon mek Rimi bi di pesin wey go dey du laik  gofnor for dat taim wey dem komot Gofnor Abdulkadir Balarabe Musa as di gofnor for June 23, 1981.
en: Abba Musa Rimi, CON (born on 28 February 1940) a Nigerian man that was appointed to rule Kaduna State in 1979 during Nigeria's Second Republic which made Rimi the acting governor when Governor Abdulkadir Balarabe Musa was impeached as the governor on June 23, 1981.

pcm: Na wen im de insaid di pati for politis wey dem dey kol People's Redemption Party na im dem tek chuz am as di gofnor of Kaduna Stet.
en: When he was in a political party called People's Redemption Party and was chosen as the governor of Kaduna State

pcm: Pope John Paul II kom Kaduna for February 1982.
en: Pope John Paul II came to Kaduna in February 1982.

pcm: Bot som pipul wey dey rul di muslim pipul dat taim no gri kom grit am.
en: But some muslim leaders did not greet him.

pcm: Wen di Pope stil dey di airport bifo im kom enta plen go bak to Lagos, e rid one tin wey dem rait to Rimi an oda pipu wey dey wok for govament sey mek evribodi dey join bodi to do tins togeda, weda you bi muslim or kristen.
en: While the Pope was still at the airport before flying back to Lagos, he read an article about Rimi and other government officials that everyone including muslims and christians should work together.

pcm: For August 1982, Rimi yuz gra-gra tok to di Jama'atul Nasril Islam (JNI) sey mek dem si as dem go fit stop di fight-fight wey dey amog di smol smol muslim grup wey dem nem na Izala an Darika Muslim grup.
en: In August 1982, Rimi violently addressed the Jama'atul Nasril Islam (JNI) to stop the fights among the small muslim groups which were Izala and Darika Muslim groups.

pcm: For March 27 1982, dat taim, Rimi kom stat di IBBI Naija wey stil dey try wel wel to dey du drink for North side for Naija.
en: On March 27 1982, Rimi started IBBI Nigeria that still produces drinks in the Northern part of Nigeria till date.

pcm: Afta General Muhammadu Buhari yuz gra-gra bigin rul Naija for  December 31 1983, E arest som of di pipul wey dey rul difren difren Stet for Naija.
en: General Muhammadu Buhari started ruling Nigeria after the coup on December 31 1983, he arrested some rulers of different states in Nigeria

pcm: For March 28 1985, dem send Rimi go 21 years for insaid prisin.
en: In March 28 1985, Rim was sentenced to 21 years imprisonment.

pcm: Dem sey im kari N500,000 dash 96 pipul for di Stet House of Assembly wey dey wok for ples wey dem dey join bodi rait evritin wey pipul sopos du an di one wey dem no sopos do.
en: It was said that he gave N500,000 to 96 people in the State House of Assembly that is the legislative arm of the government

pcm: Rimi sey im giv dem di moni bikos dem "folo do evritin wey dem sopos du for dia difren difren aria.
en: Rimi said he gave them the money because they did all that was expected  of them to do in their different areas.

pcm: Rimi wok as pesin we dey hep big big kompini laik UAC, NTC an G.B.
en: Rimi works with big companies like UAC, NTC an G.B.

pcm: OLLIVANT sel dia maket.
en: OLLIVANT sell their wares.

pcm: Afta, e kom bi di oga kpata-kpata for African Circle Pollution Management.Rimi kom stil folo bi pat of di pipul wey get Commander Order of the Niger (CON).
en: Asides from being the director general of African Circle Pollution Management, Rimi is among those who have Commander Order of the Niger (CON).

pcm: Na one wife im mari an dem don bon 7 pikin.
en: He married one wife with 7 children.

pcm: For October 1998, Rimi kom bi di pesin wey dey advais one soja-man wey bi dey rul Naija wey im nem na Abdulsalam Abubakar for di taim wey we chenj go di kind govament wey bi sey wu no bi ami fit rul Naija for di Nigerian Fourth Republic.
en: In October 1998, Rimi became a special adviser to a Nigerian military head of state, Abdulsalam Abubakar when the army took over power during the Nigerian Fourth Republic.

pcm: Abdu Gusau Polytechnic na one Stet Govament politeknik wey dey for Talata Mafara, Zamfara Stet inside Naija.
en: Abdu Gusau Polytechnic is a state polytechnic that is located in Talata Mafara, Zamfara State, Nigeria

pcm: Di politeknik don dey sins 1992 afta di gofnor wey dey bifor for Sokoto Stet, Yahaya Abdulkarim sign di bill wey dem tek mek di "Talata Mafara Polythecnic".
en: The polytechnic has been in existence since1992 after the former governor of Sokoto state, Yahaya Abdulkarim signed the bill of the change of name to   "Talata Mafara Polythecnic".

pcm: Di Sokoto Stet Govament chenj di nem of di Politeknik to "Abdu Gusau Polytechnic" in February, 1995.
en: Sokoto State Government change the name of the polytechnic to "Abdu Gusau Polytechnic" in February, 1995.

pcm: E du am to honor di late Enjinia Abdu Gusau wey dai in November, 1994 for all di tin wey e don du to divelop di Stet.Wen dey fom Zamfara Stet in 1996, dis one mek dem kari di Politeknik go a niu pamanet site in Talata Mafara.
en: He honored the late Engineer Abdu Gusau that died in November, 1994 for his tremendous work to develop the State. When Zamfara State was formed in 1996, the polytechnic was relocated to a permanent site in Talata Mafara.

pcm: Di Sokoto Stet Govament no gree mek dey yuz dia moni to dey tekia of skul wey Zamfara get, an na dis risin mek dem kari Audi Gusau Politeknik fom Sokoto Stet to Zamfara Stet.
en: The Sokoto State Government did not allow that their funds be used to run the school owned by Zamfara, as a result, Audi Gusau Politeknic was moved from Sokoto State to Zamfara State

pcm: Abdullahi Mustapha (dem bon am for February 1, 1948) na Naija profesor of Medisinal kemistri an na forma fas shanselo for Ahmadu Bello Univasiti for Zaria.
en: Abdullahi Mustapha (born on February 1, 1948)  is a Nigerian professor of Medicinal Chemistry and the former vice chancellor of Ahmadu Bello Univasiti in Zaria.

pcm: Na profesor Ibrahim Garba tek ova wen e komot as di fas shanselo (VC) for di Univasiti.
en: Na profesor Ibrahim Garba tek ova wen e komot as di fas shanselo (VC) for di Univasiti.

pcm: Dem bon profesor Mustapha for February 1, 1948.E papa am mama kom fom Katsina bot dem dey stey for Kano for Noth for Naija.
en: Professor Mustapha was born on February 1, 1948.  His parents are natives of Katsina but resided in Kano in the northern part of Nigeria

pcm: E go Ralmadadi Praimari skul for 1955 bifor e go Katsina sekondri skul.
en: He went to Ralmadadi Praimari School in 1955 before attending Katsina secondary school.

pcm: E kolet e West African Examination Certificate for 1968 for Gofment kolej, Keffi.
en: He got his West African Examination Certificate in 1968 at Government College, Keffi.

pcm: E leta go Ahmadu Bello Univasiti for 1973 wia e kolet e bashelo digri for Pharmacy.
en: He later went to Ahmadu Bello University in 1973 and graduated with a Bachelors degree in Pharmacy.

pcm: E stil kolet e Doctorate degree(Ph.D) fom Chelsea College  wey dey leta join wit King's College for London in 1981.
en: He has a Doctorate degree(Ph.D) from Chelsea College and later joined King's College, London in 1981.

pcm: Na for 1974 Profesaw Mustapha stat e tishin wok for Ahmadu Bello tishin Ospital as Pupil Pharmacist.
en: In 1974, Professor Mustapha started a teaching job in Ahmadu Bello teaching hospital as Pupil Pharmacist.

pcm: An na for 1982 dem promot am go Senior Lekshora for di Dipatment of famasitikal an medisinal kemistri.
en: In 1982, he was promoted as as a Senior Lecturer in the department of pharmaceutical and medical chemistry.

pcm: For 2010, dem giv am fas shanselo for Ahmadu Bello Univasiti.
en: In 2010, he became the vice chancellor of Ahmadu Bello University.

pcm: Bifor e bikom fas shanselo for Ahmadu Bello Univasiti, e bin dey saf as di fas shanselo for Umaru Musa Yar'adua Univasiti.
en: Before he became the vice chancellor of Ahmadu Bello University, he served as the vice chancellor of Umaru Musa Yar'adua University.

pcm: Abia State na a Stet wey dey Saunt-East jiopolitikal zone of Naija.
en: Abia State is a state in the South-East geopolitical zone of Nigeria.

pcm: Di Stet na one of the 36 Stet for Naija and di kapita na Umuahia.Di ples wey Bizness dey pass na Aba for di Stet.
en: The state is one of the 36 states in Nigeria and the capital is Umuahia. Aba is the business hub of the state

pcm: Di state slogan na "God's Own State" and di governor of di state na Okezie Ikpeazu.Di Stet wey dey di North side an NorthEast of Abia Stet na Enugu Stet, an Ebonyi Stet.Di Stet wey dey for west side of Abia Stet na Imo Stet an Kross Riva Stey dey di East pat of Abia Stet.Na Rivas Stet dey di South of di Stet an Akwa Ibom Stet dey di Southeast.
en: The state slogan is "God's Own State" and the state governor is Okezie Ikpeazu.The state is located on the North side and NorthEast of Abia State in Enugu State and Ebonyi State. The State that is located on the west side of Abia State is Imo State and Cross River State located on the East part.Rivers State is on the South of the state and Akwa Ibom Stet is on the Southeast.

pcm: Di wod ABIA kom fom di ples inside  Abia Stet wey pipul plenti pass.
en: The word "Abia" originates from a place that many people reside in Abia State

pcm: Di A stand for Aba, Di B stand for Bende, Di I stand for Isuikwuato an di A stand for Afikpo.
en: A stands for Aba, B stands for Bende, I stands for Isuikwuato and A stands for Afikpo.

pcm: Na Abia Stet bi di nomba 32 stet wey big pass among all di Stet wey dey Naija an if we dey tok abaut Stet wey pipul plenti for Naija, Abia Stet kari nomba 27.Abia Stet get ova 3,720,000 as of 2016.Jiografikali, di Stet divide into two, di "Niger Delta Swamp forest" an di dry "'Crosss-Niger transition Forest" wit som Savana for di rest of the Stet.
en: Abia State is the 32nd largest state in Nigeria and with regards population, Abia State takes the 27 position, Abia State has 3,720,000 as of 2016.Geographically, the State is divided into two, the "Niger Delta Swamp forest" and the dry "'Crosss-Niger transition Forest" with some Savana in the remaning parts of the state.

pcm: Many tribe-dem don stey an liv for Abia Stet, but for now na Igbo pipul dey liv for Abia Stet.Bifor di Oyingbo pupil kom Naija, Abia Stet dey pat of Arochukwu-based Aro Union bifor di British souja fight di Arọ grup kom win Dem in 1900s.Wen di Oyingbo win di war finish, dey kom add di aria to Souta Naija wey dey go dey kontrol as pat of Naija.
en: Many tribes have resided in Abia State, but for now the Igbo people are the present dwellers. Before the arrival of the colonizers to Nigeria, Abia State was part of the Arochukwu-based Aro Union before the British soldiers fight the Arọ group and conquered them in the 1900s.After the triumph of the colonizers, the area was added to the Southern part of Nigeria to be controlled under Nigeria.

pcm: Abia Stet giv di Oyingbo pupil dem wahala biko dey no wan stey onda dem an di korse Wumen war wey hapun stat for Oloko.
en: Abia State disturbed the white people that refused to be under them and it caused the women riot that started in Oloko

pcm: Wen Naija free from Oyingbo in 1960, Dey kari Abia Stet join di Easta Rijion onti 1967 bifor dey kom add am to East Sentral Rijion.E no rush two month leta, Abia Stet pipul join di three years Naija Sivul war as Abia pipul tok sey dey komot from Naija go join Biafra Reploblik.Wen di War end, dey kom join Abia Stet bak to Stet wey dey Naija bak ontil 1976 wen forma Presidor Murtala Muhammed era wen dey kom komot Imo Stet fom Ábíá Stet.
en: After Nigeria's independence in 1960, Abia State was added to the eastern region until 1967 before it was added to the East Central Region. It wasn't up to two months later, the Abia State people joined the three years Nigerian Civil war as Abia people said they are no longer a part of Nigeria and want to join Biafra Replublic.mmed era, Imo State was created out of Abia State.

pcm: Na petrol bizness, gas wit Agrikolshor like yam, maize, kasava, taro, red ooye dey bring Abia Stet moni.Anoda small aria wey dey giv Abia Stet moni na to dey mek tins wey pupil fit yuz an dis one plenti for Aba.
en: Abia State source of income is petrol, gas and agricultural farming of yam, maize, cassava, taro, red oil. A smaller means of income for Abia State is manufacturing.

pcm: For Stet wey dey du di best for tins to beta for Naija in edukeshon, wok an dey wey e Stet dey hep e pipul-dem, Abia Stet kari nomba Eight posishion
en: Abia State has the eighth position of states in Nigeria that have the best education, works and helping people.

pcm: Di aria wey Abia Stet dey
en: The area Abia state is located

pcm: Di land wey Abia Stet get na 6,320 square kilomitas.
en: The land mass of Abia State is 6,320 square kilometers.

pcm: Di Stet wey dey di North side an NorthEast of Abia Stet na Enugu Stet, an Ebonyi Stet.Di Stet wey dey for west side of Abia Stet na Imo Stet an Kross Riva Stey dey di East pat of Abia Stet.Na Rivas Stet dey di South of di Stet an Akwa Ibom Stet dey di Southeast.
en: The states located on the nothern side and northeast side of Abia state are Enugu State and Ebonyi state. On the west side of Abia State is Imo State while Cross River state is on the eastern part. Rivers State is on the southern side and Akwa Ibom on the southeast.

pcm: Di pat of Abia Stet wey dey south dey hey rain of 2,400 milimitas per years an rain dey plenti for April an October for di Stet.Di Rivas wey dey popula pass for di ples na Imo rivas an Aba rivas an dey flow enta Atlantik Osuhon for Akwa Ibom Stet.
en: The southern part of Abia state experiences heavy rain of about 2,400 millimeters yearly around April to October. Popular rivers in the state are Imo and Abia Rivers and the flow into Atlantic ocean throug Akwa Ibom State.

pcm: Tori abaut Abia Stet an e populashion
en: Story about Abia state and its population

pcm: Abia Stet na one of di 36 stet wey dey Naija an di Stet get 17 lokal govament aria out of di 774 lokal govament aria wey dey Naija.Na for August 27, 1991 dey kret Abia stet.Na Jeneral Ibrahim Babangida rijim time na e dey kret am.Di Stet dey South-Easta pat of Naija.Na for inside Imo Stet dey tek komot Abia Stet.
en: Abia State is one of the 36 states in Nigeria and the state 17 local governement areas out of the 774 in Nigeria. Abia state was created in August 27, 1991. It was created during the regime ofGeneral Ibrahim Babangida. The state is in the South-Eastern part of Nigeria. It was created from Imo State.

en: Omo n'Oba n'Edo Uku Akpolokpolo, Akenzua II  (January 7, 1899 – June 11, 1978) is an Oba of Benin (the ruler of the Edo people in Nigeria) from 1933 to the time of his death in 1978.

en: In 1936, he started a movement to champion the return of the Benin Bronzes that were stolen from the king's palace and ancenstral worship place when the people of Benin were attacked in 1897 back to Nigeria
